TrackingCodeCustomizer.PluginDescription: The provided values will replace the defaults in the generated tracking code (leave blank to use defaults). Viewing https://github.com/matomo-org/matomo/blob/master/core/Tracker/TrackerCodeGenerator.php is recommended to deconstruct how the tracking code is built.
TrackingCodeCustomizer.idSiteSettingDescription: The siteId that will be included in the tracking code.
TrackingCodeCustomizer.idSiteSettingHelp:
Probably not useful in most scenarios. The idSite option is included for completeness.

Default: %s
TrackingCodeCustomizer.piwikUrlSettingDescription:
The tracker URL to use.
Default: Same as Matomo installation path
TrackingCodeCustomizer.piwikUrlSettingHelp:
tracker.example.com/matomo use hostname+basepath only (omit protocol and trailing slash)

Default: %s
TrackingCodeCustomizer.httpsPiwikUrlSettingDescription: Set if the HTTPS domain is different from the normal domain.
TrackingCodeCustomizer.httpsPiwikUrlSettingHelp:
secure-tracker.example.com/matomo use hostname+basepath only (omit protocol and trailing slash)

Default: %s
TrackingCodeCustomizer.httpsPiwikUrlSettingDefault:
Empty
Note: Setting a value here will add a protocol check condition to the tracking code.
TrackingCodeCustomizer.optionsSettingDescription: A string of JavaScript code that customizes the JavaScript tracker (after _paq = _paq || [] and before trackPageView).
TrackingCodeCustomizer.optionsSettingHelp:
{$original_paramname} and {$paramname} tokens are available for referencing values.

Default: %s
TrackingCodeCustomizer.optionsBeforeTrackerUrlSettingDescriptio: A string of Javascript code that customizes the JavaScript tracker inside of anonymous function before adding setTrackerUrl into paq.
TrackingCodeCustomizer.optionsBeforeTrackerUrlSettingHelp:
{$original_paramname} and {$paramname} tokens are available for referencing values.

Default: %s
TrackingCodeCustomizer.piwikJsSettingHelp: Let's you customize the piwik.js Filename. This is useful to avoid detections by AdBlockers. Don't forget to create a rewrite rule accordingly in your web-server configuration: RewriteRule "^/p/p.(js|php)$" "/piwik/piwik.$1" [PT,L]
TrackingCodeCustomizer.piwikPhpSettingHelp: Let's you customize the piwik.php Filename. This is useful to avoid detections by AdBlockers. Don't forget to create a rewrite rule accordingly in your web-server configuration: RewriteRule "^/p/p.(js|php)$" "/piwik/piwik.$1" [PT,L] Please note that changing the trackers filename needs to be addressed when using the log analyzer (use --replay-tracking-expected-tracker-file=yourfilename.php)
TrackingCodeCustomizer.paqVariableSettingTitle: Name for _paq in Javascript tracking code
TrackingCodeCustomizer.paqVariableSettingHelp: Let's you customize the _paq JS Variable in your tracking code. This can be useful to avoid issues with multiple Piwik tracking codes on the same page.
TrackingCodeCustomizer.removePiwikBrandingSettingTitle: Remove Matomo branding comments in tracking code
TrackingCodeCustomizer.removePiwikBrandingSettingHelp: Remove the comments containing 'Matomo' out of the standard tracking code
